The Queen is based on the biography "Elizabeth: The Queen's Life" by John King.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Equalizer" from the list provided.

"The Equalizer" is a 2014 American action thriller film directed by Antoine Fuqua and starring Denzel Washington as a washed-up former special forces operative who now works freelance as a private detective. The film revolves around the story of an ex-convict named John (played by James Wilcox)) who was wrongfully convicted for murder of his wife when he was away from home at time of murder. John is released from prison after serving his time and getting cleared by court. John now becomes a free man and goes back to life, starting with finding new job as private detective. However, John soon finds himself facing new challenges, including going on dangerous missions as freelance private detective.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend two movies: "How to Train Your Dragon 2" and "The Martian".
" How to Train Your Dragon 2 " is a animated film that follows the adventures of Hiccup and Toothless as they battle against their enemies while also working together to achieve common goals.
"The Martian", on the other hand, is a science fiction film directed by Ridley Scott. The movie follows the story of an astronaut named Mark Watney who becomes stranded alone on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive and can survive until a potential rescue.
Overall, "How to Train Your Dragon 2" and "The Martian" are both excellent movies with great plots, actors, and special effects.

This movie follows the life of a washed-up professional golfer named Ray Kroc who has turned his attention towards starting up fast-food chains.
